item.title: Courage

By understanding the symbolism of animal sacrifice in the Old Testament, we come to realize its similarity to the sacrament—to remember the Savior and to commit ourselves to him.

item.description: Children around the world have taken President Thomas S. Monsons counsel to find a way to serve others.

item.description: Three modern-day wise men show us that the greatest gift we can give Jesus Christ is the will of our hearts.

item.description: The Coat is a children’s story that depicts a young boy giving selflessly to another child in need.

item.title: We Can Have His Light

item.title: Patterns of Light: Discerning Light
item.description: How do we recognize divine light and discern it from our own thoughts? In part 2 of this three part series, Elder David A. Bednar discusses how to discern and act upon light from God.

item.title: Reverence Invites Revelation
item.description: (Mark 11:15-18) President Boyd K. Packer teaches of the importance of reverence in receiving revelation.

item.title: Spirit Whispers
item.description: (1 Kings 19:11-13) President Eyring teaches that the Spirit will bear testimony if we listen.

item.title: Still, Small Voice
item.description: (1 Kings 19:11-13) President Packer lists the doctrines and principles taught in the Old Testament.

item.title: Enemy Territory
item.description: President Boyd K. Packer shares an experience in which he was protected during World War II by listening to a prompting from the Spirit and promises youth that they will be protected if they heed the promptings that come from the Holy Ghost.

item.title: Having the Holy Ghost
item.description: You can invite the Holy Spirit into your life through prayer, scripture study and being obedient to God’s commandments.

item.title: Feeling the Holy Ghost
item.description: Feelings of the Holy Spirit can be likened to hope, joy and peace in your heart and mind.

item.title: Increase Your Testimony
item.description: Strengthen your testimony of God and His teachings by recognizing the feelings of the Holy Spirit.

item.title: receiving revelation
item.description: You can receive personal revelation from God by living His gospel and having the gift of the Holy Spirit.

item.title: Guided by the Holy Spirit
item.description: Every one of us can be guided by the spirit of revelation and the gift of the Holy Ghost.

item.title: Voice of the Spirit
item.description: In a world full of noise and many voices, President James E. Faust invites us to listen to and follow the voice of the Spirit, which is calm and quiet and leads to eternal life.

item.title: Guided Safely Home
item.description: Highlight of President Thomas S. Monsons address at the October 2014 General Conference.

item.title: Face to Face with Elder and Sister Bednar
item.description: Face to Face with Elder and Sister Bednar

item.title: Do What Is Right
item.description: The choir and congregation sing “Do What Is Right.”

item.title: Nephi Proves His Innocence
item.description: (Helaman 1–12) The prophet Nephi foretells the murder of the chief judge as a testimony of the people’s wickedness. Segment 3, Nephi Proves His Innocence.

item.title: Oh Say, What Is Truth?
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “Oh Say, What Is Truth?”

item.title: Ananias And Sapphira
item.description: (Acts 5:1-11) Neal A. Maxwell speaks about lying.

item.title: Honesty: You Better Believe It!
item.description: It is better to be honest than get a good score on a test.

item.title: Be Honest
item.description: Quote given by Sister Ann M. Dibb in the general Young Women meeting on March 26, 2011.

item.title: Stay in the Boat and Hold on!
item.description: The Lord has provided help, including a boat and essential supplies such as life jackets, and experienced river guides to help us make our way down the river of life to our final destination.

item.title: A Mothers Hope
item.description: When President Uchtdorf was a young child, he learned that his mother was a great example of how hope and faith can overcome fear.

item.title: Hope Leads
item.description: (Moroni 10:20–23) President Dieter F. Uchtdorf talks about hope.

item.title: Miracles
item.description: (Mark 1:23; 2:12) President Harold B. Lee says the greatest miracles today are the healing of sick souls.

item.title: God Will Lift Us Up
item.description: Rather than focus on her medical condition, Brittany has found comfort in serving others and trusting in the Lord.

item.title: Hope
item.description: Our hope in the Atonement empowers us with eternal perspective.

item.title: Im a Mormon, Single Mother, and Special Needs Advocate
item.description: Even as a single parent, Anne Row is a Mormon mother who turns her hardships into courage, faith, and love for others. See more about Anne at www.mormon.org/anne

item.title: Im a Mormon, Addict Caretaker, and Voice for the Homeless
item.description: Sally Marks draws upon Christ-like empathy to help the homeless and those recovering from addiction. Shes a Mormon who sees herself as a voice for those whom society cant hear. Read more at www.mormon.org/sally

item.title: The Missing Piece
item.description: Jesus Christ and His gospel help a man find direction amid adversity. Read Elder L. Tom Perrys talk Let Him Do It with Simplicity.

item.title: Good Things to Come
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland recalls his days as a poor young father with a broken-down family car and testifies that for those who embrace the gospel of Jesus Christ, there are better days and good things to come.

item.title: Lifting Burdens
item.description: Apostles of Jesus Christ testify of the Saviors power to heal, change, and purify us through His Atonement.

item.title: The Power of Hope
item.description: President Dieter F. Uchtdorf, an Apostle of the Lord Jesus Christ, shares how hope encourages and inspires us to place our trust in the loving care of our Heavenly Father and His Son, Jesus Christ.

item.title: Youre Never Alone
item.description: A disciple of Jesus Christ, Elaine S. Dalton, describes how a grueling marathon taught her about prayer and the strength we can receive from God.

item.title: Hope Ya Know, We Had a Hard Time
item.description: Elder Quentin L. Cook testifies that the Atonement of Jesus Christ can help us pass through the challenges and trials of this life with hope and assurance in Gods love for us.

item.title: The Reason for Our Hope
item.description: Highlight of President Boyd K. Packers address at the October 2014 General Conference.

item.title: Choose to Be Humble
item.description: (1 Samuel 15:10-35) President Hinckley encourages church member to choose to be humble.

item.title: Our Hands, His Hands; Our Hearts, His Heart
item.description: A very independent girl with cerebral palsy learns to humble herself and ask for help.

item.title: Jesus Teaches that We Must Become as Little Children
item.description: Those who humble themselves as little children are the greatest in the kingdom of heaven.

item.title: If They Harden Not Their Hearts
item.description: This video depicts how pride led to the apostasy of Lyman Johnson and Thomas B. Marsh (DC 112:1-16).

item.title: Chapter 39: Nephi Receives Great Power
item.description: Nephi is saddened by the wickedness of the Nephites. He prays for a famine to humble them.

item.title: Five Loaves and Two Fishes
item.description: (Mark 6:32–44) President James E. Faust shares how the humble, everyday actions of typical members of the Church is equal to the miracle of the loaves and fishes. An excerpt from “Five Loaves and Two Fishes,” Ensign, May 1994.

item.title: Heber J. Grant: Documentary
item.description: A documentary of Heber J. Grant that teaches his humility in serving to benefit the welfare of others.

item.title: He Teaches Us to Put Off the Natural Man
item.description: I bear witness of the reality and power of the Savior’s Atonement to cleanse, purify, and make us and our homes holy.

item.title: “Lord, I Believe”
item.description: Honestly acknowledge your questions and your concerns, but first and forever fan the flame of your faith, because all things are possible to them that believe.

item.title: Called of Him to Declare His Word
item.description: If you are humble and obedient and hearken to the voice of the Spirit, you will find great happiness in your service as a missionary.

item.title: Beware of Pride
item.description: President Ezra Taft Benson delivers a message titled Beware of Pride

item.title: Pride and the Priesthood
item.description: Pride is a switch that turns off priesthood power. Humility is a switch that turns it on.

item.title: We Have Kept the Faith
item.description: Eduardo Ayala delivers a message titled We Have Kept the Faith.

item.title: Faith, Devotion, and Gratitude
item.description: I hope that we have grateful hearts for the knowledge that we have and the testimonies we have and for the feelings we have.

item.title: “To Walk Humbly with Thy God”
item.description: True humility will inevitably lead us to say to God, “Thy will be done.”

item.title: Retaining a Remission of Sin
item.description: King Benjamin taught three basic principles that can help us retain a remission of our sins: first, to remain humble; second, to call upon the Lord daily; and third, to stand steadfast in the faith.

item.title: An Humble and a Contrite Heart
item.description: If we have drawn nearer to the Savior, with a more firm resolution to follow His teachings and His example, then this conference will have been a wonderful success.

item.title: Suffer the Little Children to Come unto Me
item.description: Jesus invites little children to come unto him, and teaches how to gain eternal life.

item.title: Mary, the Mother of Jesus
item.description: Mary was highly favored of God and chosen to be the mother of Jesus Christ. Her humility, devotion, and strength stand as a model for all Christian disciples.

item.title: The Wise Men Seek Jesus
item.description: The Wise Men present Jesus with gifts—gold, frankincense, and myrrh. After their visit, Mary and Joseph flee to Egypt to protect Jesus from the wicked King Herod, who wishes to kill the child.

item.title: The Christ Child Is Presented at the Temple
item.description: Mary and Joseph take Jesus to the temple, where the righteous Simeon blesses the baby and rejoices that the Lord let him live to see this day.

item.title: Shepherds Learn of the Birth of Christ
item.description: The angel Gabriel announces the birth of Jesus to the shepherds. The shepherds then visit Mary, Joseph, and the newborn Jesus.

item.title: The Greatest Gift
item.description: On Christmas morning, amid presents and torn wrappings, a young man gets a reminder of the greatest gift of all.

item.title: He Lives: Testimonies of Jesus Christ
item.description: See and hear modern-day Apostles testify that Jesus Christ is the Savior and that He lives today.

item.title: The Only True God and Jesus Christ Whom He Has Sent
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland testifies of the Savior and what it means to be Christian.

item.title: Young Jesus Teaches in the Temple
item.description: Mary and Joseph find Jesus about His fathers business, teaching in the temple.

item.title: Highlight: I Have Given You an Example—Richard G. Scott
item.description: Richard G. Scott explains how we can follow the Saviors example and be a loving influence for good in the lives of others.

item.title: Highlight: Christ the Redeemer—Carlos H. Amado
item.description: Carlos H. Amado testifies that all who have lived or will live on earth are blessed by the Atonement of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Which Way Do You Face?
item.description: Highlight of Elder Lynn G. Robbinss address at the October 2014 General Conference.

item.title: Ponder the Path of Thy Feet
item.description: Highlight of President Thomas S. Monsons address at the October 2014 General Conference.

item.title: The Kingdom of Heaven
item.description: The kingdom of heaven consists of the just separated out from the wicked.

item.title: Be Ye Therefore Perfect
item.description: (3 Nephi 12:48) Elder Joseph B. Wirthlin speaks of the charge to become perfect like the Savior.

item.title: The Merciful Obtain Mercy
item.description: When our hearts are filled with the love of God, we become “kind one to another, tenderhearted, forgiving.”

item.title: The Merciful Obtain Mercy
item.description: When our hearts are filled with the love of God, we become “kind one to another, tenderhearted, forgiving.”

item.title: Judging Others? Stop It!
item.description: Statement by President Dieter F. Uchtdorf in the Sunday morning session on April 1, 2012.

item.title: Looking through Windows
item.description: We should be careful how we judge others, as we may be looking at them through our own unclean windows. Read President Monsons full address, Charity Never Faileth here: http://bit.ly/d8J2Lh

item.title: The Civility Experiment
item.description: Learn how civility and kindness go much deeper than appearances and quick judgments. Read President Thomas S. Monson’s full address, “Charity Never Faileth.”

item.title: Judgment
item.description: A girl shares her feelings about judgment and the true individual worth of each of us.

item.title: What Manner of Men and Women Ought Ye to Be?
item.description: November 2, 2008: Bishop H. David Burton speaks about what constitutes true success in life.

item.title: Follow the Prophet
item.description: Carol F. McConkie, First Counselor in the Young Women’s Presidency, describes why God calls prophets. A group of youth discover the importance of listening to the right voices when charting their course.

item.title: Obedience to the Ten Commandments
item.description: As children of God, we have been given the wonderful gift of choice. The truest happiness and peace we can have comes by choosing to obey His laws.

item.title: Living with Purpose and Real Intent
item.description: The gospel teaches us who we are and helps us maintain focus on our eternal purpose. Living with real intent ensures we reach the full measure of our creation.

item.title: You Never Know
item.description: Sometimes, the most important things you do each day are never even on your “to-do” list. You might worry about the things you never get done, but President Gordon B. Hinckley reminds us, “You never know how much good you do.”

item.title: Obedience Brings Blessings
item.description: President Monson talks on blessings of obedience. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Leave the Party
item.description: Johns life may have been very different had he not had the courage to leave a party one evening in Japan.

item.title: Wrong Roads
item.description: When making decisions, God expects us to pray, trust, and be believing and then not give up, panic, or jump ship when something doesnt seem to be going right.

item.title: A Secure Anchor
item.description: Just like rock climbing alone can be dangerous, living your life without the help of the Savior can have disastrous consequences.

item.title: Mountains to Climb
item.description: Finding faith in the Lord Jesus Christ will help us have the power to endure and overcome even the hardest trials in life.

item.title: An Eye Single to the Glory of God
item.description: (DC 82:19) Elder Nelson compares our perspective and the Lords to a pair of binoculars.

item.title: Stay within the Lines
item.description: Just as athletes must stay within lines to compete in sports, those who are called to labor in the Lords work must stay within the lines of worthiness.

item.title: Teachings of John Taylor: Obedience
item.description: John Taylor demonstrates obedience to God despite the worlds intolerance.

item.title: Teachings of Brigham Young: Hard Work, Sacrifice, Obedience
item.description: Brigham Young describes the blessings that come from faithfully facing lifes challenges.

item.title: Will We Be Willing?
item.description: Statement by President Thomas S. Monson in the priesthood session on March 31, 2012.

item.title: The Sting of the Scorpion
item.description: A young boy’s encounter with a scorpion in the Arabian desert can teach us a lot about what we must do to avoid and overcome the venomous sting of sin.

item.title: Mormon Mustang
item.description: While flying in a historic airplane, youth learn about the dangers of pushing the envelope.

item.title: Life
item.description: This video depicts typography showing questions and answers about the purpose of life.

item.title: Chapter 62: Paul Obeys the Holy Ghost
item.description: Paul listens to the Holy Ghost and goes to Jerusalem, even though he knows they will put him in prison.

item.title: Within Bounds
item.description: Staying in bounds—on the ski slopes and in life—leads to joy and safety.

item.title: Chapter 9: Abraham and the Sacrifice of Isaac
item.description: God commands Abraham to sacrifice his son Isaac. Abraham shows his obedience to the Lord, but an angel tells him to stop. The Lord provides a ram for the sacrifice.

item.title: Spiritual Vertigo
item.description: A World War II fighter pilot teaches youth some essential truths to fly by—and to live by.

item.title: President Henry B. Eyring Testifies of Jesus Christ
item.description: President Eyring teaches that the Savior is mindful of us and will guide us through life’s trials.

item.title: Courage
item.description: Learn from the life of Esther and other inspiring women the importance of trusting in God and courageously standing up for what you believe.

item.title: The Will of God
item.description: God uses love-inspired correction to guide us to a future we do not or cannot now envision but which He knows is the better way for us.

item.title: Becoming Provident Providers
item.description: Elder Robert D. Hales encourages us to stay out of debt and live frugally as he recounts a story from the early days of his marriage, when his wife exemplified the principles of provident living.

item.title: President Henry B. Eyring Testifies of Jesus Christ
item.description: President Eyring teaches that the Savior is mindful of us and will guide us through life’s trials.

item.title: Renaissance of Marriage
item.description: Hear what President Eyring says we all must do to have a renaissance of happy marriages and productive families.

item.title: My Brother Hyrum
item.description: Learn about Hannahs relationship with her brother Hyrum who has autism, and how she exemplifies Christlike love. Everyone deserves to be loved and valued, no matter how different they are from you.

item.title: Home and Family - Through Small Things
item.description: Challenged by their bishop, three youth learn what it takes to make their home a holy place.

item.title: Ordinances and Covenants - The Spirit of Elijah
item.description: A young woman and her family discover the unanticipated blessings of family history work.

item.title: Proclamation Series: Children
item.description: Parents are responsible to teach children to love and serve one another and to obey the commandments.

item.title: Good, Better, Best
item.description: Elder Dallin H. Oaks explains ways to maintain a family firm and strong in spirit.

item.title: Families Can Be Together Forever
item.description: Increase your understanding of the Lord’s purpose for families and of the blessings He makes available to them.

item.title: Unto All The World: Corrada Favaloros Story
item.description: Corrada Favaloro, a church member in Rome, recounts how a message from President Boyd K. Packer gave her hope for her wayward son.

item.title: Video Presentation: Walk in His Light
item.description: Daughters of God support and love one another as they live covenant-centered lives.

item.title: Highlight: Roots and Branches—Quentin L. Cook
item.description: Quentin L. Cook teaches the importance of hastening family history and temple work in our day, including through modern technology.

item.title: Parents: The Prime Gospel Teachers of Their Children
item.description: Highlight of Tad R. Callisters address at the October 2014 General Conference.

item.title: Finding Lasting Peace and Building Eternal Families
item.description: Highlight of Elder L. Tom Perrys address at the October 2014 General Conference.

item.title: The Book
item.description: Highlight of Elder Allan F. Packers address at the October 2014 General Conference.

item.title: Special Witness - Elder Cook
item.description: Elder Cook shares the history of missionary work and bears his apostolic testimony of the work.

item.title: Unto All The World: Hastening the Work in Europe
item.description: Elder Ballard and Elder Oaks of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles visit Europe to help an influx of new missionaries hasten the work of salvation.

item.title: Unto All The World: Jean Collins Story
item.description: Elder M. Russell Ballards testimony that “every living soul is precious” is illustrated by the conversion story of a man from Paris, France.

item.title: Sugar Beets and the Worth of a Soul
item.description: President Monson describes how to reach out to less-active young women.

item.title: A Priesthood Duty
item.description: President Thomas S. Monson speaks to young people about missionary service—a duty for young men and a rewarding option for young women.

item.title: Same Jersey
item.description: It’s Friday night—the big rivalry game between two Arizona high school football teams. The quarterbacks are opponents tonight, and tomorrow one of them will baptize the other into the Church of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Mormon Missionaries
item.description: A glimpse into the life of a missionary of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

item.title: Im a Mormon, Professional Rugby Player, and Missionary
item.description: At age 19, Will Hopoate is a professional rugby player. He will soon be a Mormon missionary and sees it as a chance to thank God for his blessings. View Will’s video portrait at www.mormon.org/william

item.title: Peter and John Continue Preaching the Gospel
item.description: Peter and John continue preaching and healing in the name of Jesus Christ, despite the attempts of the Jewish leaders to stop them.

item.title: From Rugby Pitch to Mission Field
item.description: Quote given by Elder Neil L. Andersen in the priesthood session of general conference on April 2, 2011.

item.title: 6 Brothers
item.description: A family of six boys shares how missionary work has become a part of their daily lives.

item.title: Value of a Full-Time Mission
item.description: Missionaries from around the world share their testimonies of blessings received from choosing to serve a mission.

item.title: Why Mormons send missionaries around the world
item.description: Mormons send missionaries to help others and to share the gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Cape Verde, Land of Light
item.description: A brief history celebrating the growth of the Church in Cabo Verde leading up to the formation of the first stake in the region. Former missionaries and natives of Cabo Verde all share their experiences of church growth.

item.title: Your Day for a Mission
item.description: At 19, Sid Going was a shoo-in for New Zealands national rugby team, but he chose to serve a mission first. Elder Neil L. Andersen tells why Sid made the decision and how the blessings of a mission outweigh any sacrifice.

item.title: Sharing Your Beliefs
item.description: Use blogging, texting, and other forms of communication to share your testimony of the gospel to all the world.

item.title: Without Fear
item.description: An Italian missionary suffering from diabetes recounts how he didnt serve his mission until he received his patriarchal blessing.

item.title: Ask the Missionaries! They Can Help You!
item.description: All missionaries, younger and older, serve with the sole hope of making life better for other people.

item.title: Missionaries Are a Treasure of the Church
item.description: I am thankful that missionaries are called by the Lord, that they respond to that call, and that they are serving throughout the world.

item.title: The Opportunity of a Lifetime
item.description: Through your devoted service and willing sacrifice, your mission will become holy ground to you.

item.title: We Are All Enlisted
item.description: From every man, young and old, who bears the priesthood, I ask for a stronger and more devoted voice, … a voice for good, a voice for the gospel, a voice for God.

item.title: Rescue in Unity
item.description: Highlight of Elder Chi Hong Wongs address at the October 2014 General Conference.

item.title: Come And See
item.description: Highlight of Elder David A. Bednars address at the October 2014 General Conference.

item.title: Make a Mothers Day Happy
item.description: Join us to see how much time we can give back to mom’s within 48 hours. Share your moments using the #TimeForMom and we will count the hours you are giving to make a mother’s day happy. Visit Mormon Channel for more info on how to make a Mothers Day Happy

item.title: To Every Mother
item.description: A tribute to all of the mothers in our lives; those we know, and those who came before. We are who we are largely because of our mother. Honor your mother by preserving the memories of her on familysearch.org.

item.title: It Was Mom: A Mother’s Day Tribute To Moms
item.description: Mother’s Day celebrates moms who gave us life and taught us how to live. This Mother’s Day visit motherhood.mormon.org to see why motherhood has been deemed the highest, holiest calling in the world.

item.title: I’m a Mormon, Mom of Two Autistic Boys, and a Teacher
item.description: Mormon Michelle Paniagua is not just a bilingual teacher. She’s also a mom of two autistic boys with special challenges of their own. See how faith guides her life at www.mormon.org/michelle

item.title: A Mothers Hope
item.description: When President Uchtdorf was a young child, he learned that his mother was a great example of how hope and faith can overcome fear.

item.title: Mary, the Mother of Jesus
item.description: Mary was highly favored of God and chosen to be the mother of Jesus Christ. Her humility, devotion, and strength stand as a model for all Christian disciples.

item.title: Love Her Mother
item.description: How can a father raise a happy, well-adjusted daughter in todays increasingly toxic world?

item.title: An Angel Foretells Christ’s Birth to Mary
item.description: The angel Gabriel, sent from the presence of God, announces to the young Mary her future role as the mother of the child Jesus.

item.title: Im a Mormon, Mother, and Spanish Newscaster
item.description: For Spaniard Irene and her husband, the best financial solution after their son was born was for Irene to keep working as a producer and anchor at a Spanish language daily newscast. Read more at www.mormon.org/Irene

item.title: Im a Mormon, Parisian, and Mother of 7
item.description: Nadja Pettitt speaks a half-dozen languages, lives in Paris, and when shes not busy raising seven kids, she runs her own business. Its her own way of raising a happy Mormon family. See more at www.mormon.org/nadja

item.title: Im a Mormon, Devoted Mother, and Avid Photographer
item.description: Shawni Pothier admits that motherhood is an experiment and her parenting strategies work about half the time. Still, she s a Mormon mother who finds joy in capturing precious moments. See Shawni at www.mormon.org/shawni

item.title: Im a Mormon, a Mother, and Finnish Born Photographer
item.description: For Beatta Bosworth, home is where you make memories with the people you love. This Mormon mother is doing just that, and uses photography to stay in touch with her own Finnish home. See more at www.mormon.org/beatta

item.title: I’m a Mormon, Texan, and Mother of Two Disabled Sons
item.description: Rochelle Tallmadge is a Mormon mom of four. Two of her boys have special needs. See why she believes theyre here to bring love to the world and teach the rest of us compassion. See more at www.mormon.org/rochelle.

item.title: Im a Mormon, Public Health Advocate and Mother of Three
item.description: Emily and Aaron Sherinian are two working Mormon parents, striving to maintain their hectic professional schedules while staying focused on their family. See more about the Sherinians at www.mormon.org/emily

item.title: Im a Mormon, Mother of Three, and Joyful Artist
item.description: As a free-spirited mother, Cassandra Barney encourages her children to explore creativity in her studio. Family and career blend for this Mormon artist like the colors on her brush. See more at www.mormon.org/cassandra

item.title: Im a Mormon, Single Mother, and Special Needs Advocate
item.description: Even as a single parent, Anne Row is a Mormon mother who turns her hardships into courage, faith, and love for others. See more about Anne at www.mormon.org/anne

item.title: Im a Mormon, Mother, and Filipino-American Artist
item.description: A talented Filipino-American artist, Rose Dall, notes her greatest lifes work is not her paintings but her family. The effects of mothering, she says, will far outlast her career. Read more at www.mormon.org/rose

item.title: Im a Mormon, Former Journalist, and Dedicated Mother
item.description: Jane Clayson Johnson once interviewed the U.S. President and anchored Good Morning America. Then this Mormon woman put her plans on hold to fulfill another lifelong dream: become a mother. See more at www.mormon.org/jane

item.title: Motherhood: An Eternal Partnership With God
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland shares an encouraging tribute to mothers who, through both challenges and accomplishments, work in partnership with God to raise His children.

item.title: Mothers and Daughters
item.description: Young women in Alberta, Canada, talk about why their mothers are such good examples for them. Elder M. Russell Ballard teaches about the blessings and importance of the special relationship between mothers and daughters.

item.title: Happy Mothers Day, Mom!
item.description: Youth wish a happy Mothers Day to the women they love and appreciate most in their lives.

item.title: I’m a Mormon and Wife of a Fallen Soldier
item.description: Mormon Vendella has two heroes. One is her husband, who was killed in Iraq. The other is Jesus Christ, through whom she believes all things are possible. She tells her story at www.mormon.org/vendella

item.title: I’m a Mormon and Mother to 79 Orphaned Children
item.description: The letter contained a single phrase: “Come, all hands are needed.” So Cécile sold her Paris home, brought her hands to Nepal, and built an orphanage. More at www.mormon.org/Cecile

item.title: Im a Mormon, Cultural Mesh, and Self-Invented Cook
item.description: Nadia Las Deskins is a Mormon mother devoted to passing on her Persian heritage. She teaches her children Farsi, cooks her grandmothers recipes, and makes room for one more at the table. See more at www.mormon.org/nadia

item.title: This is My Mother
item.description: Family history work can help us see how were alike.

item.title: Im a Mormon, Mother, and Caretaker of Bulgarian Orphans
item.description: Mormon mother Deborah Gardner cares for not only her own five children, but thousands of Bulgarian orphans whose physical and emotional needs are met through her service. See more at www.mormon.org/deborah

item.title: Im a Mormon, Mother, Survivor and Cancer Fighter
item.description: Tessa Winger was diagnosed with Hodgkins lymphoma at 16. Now the cancer is back. But this radiant Mormon mother of two feels the hand of God in her life. See Tessas story at www.mormon.org/Tessa

item.title: Im a Mormon, Mother, Grandmother, and Foster Parent
item.description: Elizabeth takes in anything to which she can offer a better life – children, animals, garage sale items. Shes a Mormon set on making a difference. See more at www.mormon.org/elizabeth

item.title: Im a Mormon, Kiwi, Mother, and Polkadot Entertainer
item.description: She’s a Polkadot. He’s a Polkadot groupie. She’s an eyebrow guru. He’s a crown prosecutor. But best of all, she’s a nutter and he adores her for it. See more on this Mormon couple at www.mormon.org/dionne

item.title: Im a Mormon, World Squash Champion, and Imperfect Mother
item.description: Years after conquering the game of squash, Mormon world champion Leilani Rorani learned that conquering the challenges of life requires a different type of perfection. Visit Leilanis page at www.mormon.org/leilani

item.title: I’m a Mormon, a Dancer, and a Mom
item.description: As a teacher, a dancer, and a mother, Leila strives to give children the love and support that she never had as a child. See more at www.mormon.org/leila

item.title: Lesson 1: The Message of the New Testament
item.description: Elder Thomas S. Monson speaks of the message of hope and joy in the New Testament.

item.title: Lesson 5: The Woman at the Well
item.description: Jesus teaches a Samaritan woman that He is the source of living water.

item.title: Lesson 10: Come Unto Me
item.description: A woman anoints Jesuss feet with oil. Jesus teaches the parable of the two debtors.

item.title: Lesson 16: New Testament Customs—Shepherd and Sheepfold
item.description: The sheep trust and follow only the voice of the shepherd.

item.title: Lesson 20: New Testament Customs—Phylacteries
item.description: Pharisees boast of their righteousness with larger phylacteries and longer garment fringes.

item.title: Lesson 22: New Testament Customs—Marriage
item.description: Traditionally, the bridegroom journeys through town to meet his bride.

item.title: Lesson 23: New Testament Customs—Feasting
item.description: Feasting was done reclining on couches.

item.title: Lesson 25: New Testament Customs—Olive Press
item.description: Gethsemane means oil press.

item.title: Lesson 31: The Second Coming
item.description: President Boyd K. Packer and Elder Neal A. Maxwell give counsel and caution regarding the Second Coming.

item.title: Lesson 38: Paul—A Chosen Vessel
item.description: This segment relates the life and mission of Paul.

item.title: Obedience to the Ten Commandments
item.description: As children of God, we have been given the wonderful gift of choice. The truest happiness and peace we can have comes by choosing to obey His laws.

item.title: Follow the Prophet
item.description: Carol F. McConkie, First Counselor in the Young Women’s Presidency, describes why God calls prophets. A group of youth discover the importance of listening to the right voices when charting their course.

item.title: Will We Be Willing?
item.description: Statement by President Thomas S. Monson in the priesthood session on March 31, 2012.

item.title: Spiritual Vertigo
item.description: A World War II fighter pilot teaches youth some essential truths to fly by—and to live by.

item.title: The Sting of the Scorpion
item.description: A young boy’s encounter with a scorpion in the Arabian desert can teach us a lot about what we must do to avoid and overcome the venomous sting of sin.

item.title: A Secure Anchor
item.description: Just like rock climbing alone can be dangerous, living your life without the help of the Savior can have disastrous consequences.

item.title: Within Bounds
item.description: Staying in bounds—on the ski slopes and in life—leads to joy and safety.

item.title: Leave the Party
item.description: Johns life may have been very different had he not had the courage to leave a party one evening in Japan.

item.title: An Eye Single to the Glory of God
item.description: (DC 82:19) Elder Nelson compares our perspective and the Lords to a pair of binoculars.

item.title: Chapter 62: Paul Obeys the Holy Ghost
item.description: Paul listens to the Holy Ghost and goes to Jerusalem, even though he knows they will put him in prison.

item.title: Cling to Gods Values
item.description: (Numbers 6:1-21) President Hinckley encourages saints to cling to Gods values.

item.title: Mormon Mustang
item.description: While flying in a historic airplane, youth learn about the dangers of pushing the envelope.

item.title: Obedience Brings Blessings
item.description: President Monson talks on blessings of obedience. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Stay within the Lines
item.description: Just as athletes must stay within lines to compete in sports, those who are called to labor in the Lords work must stay within the lines of worthiness.

item.title: Teachings of Brigham Young: Hard Work, Sacrifice, Obedience
item.description: Brigham Young describes the blessings that come from faithfully facing lifes challenges.

item.title: Teachings of John Taylor: Obedience
item.description: John Taylor demonstrates obedience to God despite the worlds intolerance.

item.title: Our Pioneer Legacy
item.description: Elder Oaks teaches about our pioneer legacy (DC 136:1-11).

item.title: Pioneers
item.description: Dallin H. Oaks, Apostle of the Lord Jesus Christ, pays tribute to modern-day pioneers who faithfully follow Jesus Christ.

item.title: A Long Line of Faithful, Righteous Women
item.description: The heritage of Relief Society is not just about women who lived in the past; it is also about women all over the world today who make and keep covenants.

item.title: Zions Camp
item.description: (DC 105) Several events from the march of Zions Camp show how it fulfilled the purposes of God.

item.title: Reviewing the Lessons of the Past
item.description: Are you preparing for your future? Journey with us as Elder Perry teaches us how to prepare. Read Elder Perrys full address: http://bit.ly/9Ws2qV.

item.title: Special Witness - Elder Andersen
item.description: Elder Andersen speaks about the trials that the early Saints went through and bears testimony of the love of the Savior Jesus Christ.

item.title: Special Witness - Elder Cook
item.description: Elder Cook shares the history of missionary work and bears his apostolic testimony of the work.

item.title: Convenience Versus Covenants
item.description: (Matthew 19:27–29) An excerpt from “Like a Flame Unquenchable,” Ensign, May 1999, 86.

item.title: Chapter 60: The Saints Leave Nauvoo (September 1845–September 1846)
item.description: The Lord chooses Brigham Young to be the leader after Joseph Smiths death. Mobs drive the Saints out of Nauvoo. The Saints travel in very difficult circumstances.

item.title: Chapter 61: The Mormon Battalion (June 1846–July 1847)
item.description: Brigham Young encourages men to help the United States army in a war against Mexico.

item.title: Chapter 62: The Saints Establish Winter Quarters (1846–1847)
item.description: Under the guidance of Brigham Young, the Saints postpone their trek west and establish Winter Quarters.

item.title: Chapter 63: The Pioneers Go to the Salt Lake Valley (April–July 1847)
item.description: The pioneers travel from Council Bluffs to the Salt Lake Valley. They set up Winter Quarters. The Lord tells Brigham Young to divide the people into companies.

item.title: Chapter 64: The Saints in the Rocky Mountains (Beginning in July 1847)
item.description: The Saints establish homes in the Salt Lake Valley. They build temples in the West. Many members from distant lands come to be with the Saints.

item.title: The Kingdom of Heaven
item.description: The kingdom of heaven consists of the just separated out from the wicked.

item.title: Jesus Declares the Parable of the Wheat and the Tares
item.description: Jesus declares the parable of the wheat and the tares to the disciples.

item.title: What Mormons Believe
item.description: A summary of the core beliefs and doctrines of members of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

item.title: The Plan of Salvation
item.description: Heavenly Fathers plan of salvation is compared to a three-act play, showing that knowledge of the plan helps us in our everyday lives.

item.title: Plan of Salvation - We’re Still a Family
item.description: A young man shares how the plan of salvation has helped him to see the blessings that can come through trials.

item.title: Our Eternal Life
item.description: We are eternal beings. We lived as spirits before we were born and we will continue to live after we die.

item.title: Jesus Teaches of Being Born Again
item.description: In the darkness of night, Jesus teaches Nicodemus about the necessity of every person being born again.

item.title: The Race of Life
item.description: Where did we come from? Why are we here? Where do we go after this life? No longer need these universal questions remain unanswered.

item.title: Jesus Is Scourged and Crucified
item.description: A band of soldiers strips Jesus of His clothes, scourges Him, and mocks Him. He then carries His cross to Golgotha and is crucified by Roman soldiers.

item.title: Jesus Is Condemned Before Pilate
item.description: Jesus is arraigned and questioned before Pilate, who finds no fault in Him. Yielding to the multitude, Pilate allows Barabbas to be released and Jesus to be crucified.

item.title: Jesus Is Tried by Caiaphas, Peter Denies Knowing Him
item.description: Jesus is tried before Caiaphas and the chief priests. Peter denies knowing Him and weeps bitterly.

item.title: Eternal Truth
item.description: Family relationships can and will exist beyond the grave as families make and keep sacred ordinances and covenants in God’s holy temples.

item.title: We Can Live With God Again
item.description: Our lives will not end when we die. Our future lives are determined by the way we live our lives now.

item.title: We Can Find Happiness
item.description: See the stories of three people who find happiness through the plan of salvation as taught in the gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Life
item.description: This video depicts typography showing questions and answers about the purpose of life.

item.title: Purpose of Life—Irene
item.description: Irene talks about the purpose of life.

item.title: What Happens When I Die?
item.description: Church members relate how we will live again after this life because of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Preparation for the Afterlife
item.description: A family talks about what keeps their family going.

item.title: Life after Death—Jean
item.description: Jean explains that there is a continuation of family and everything else in the next life.

item.title: Purpose of Life—Terrence
item.description: Terrence explains how he had always felt that there had to be more than this life.

item.title: Purpose of Life—Doug
item.description: Doug discusses how he found his purpose to life.

item.title: Purpose of Life—Simon
item.description: Simon talks about the purpose of life in relation to Gods plan for us.

item.title: Purpose of Life—Linda
item.description: Linda talks about what its like to realize this life has purpose and meaning.

item.title: Purpose of Life—Jan
item.description: Jan talks about the purpose of life.

item.title: Purpose of Life—Isaiah
item.description: Isaiah describes how he found the purpose of life through Heavenly Fathers plan.

item.title: Unto All The World: Felicitys Story
item.description: Unto All The World: Felicitys Story

item.title: Overcoming Pornography Addiction: The Healing Power of Jesus Christ
item.description: Pornography addiction is a plague like we have never seen, but God knows about this and has provided an escape through the healing power of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Meet Kerri
item.description: Kerri is devastated by her husbands addiction to pornography, but finds hope and healing through the Atonement of Jesus Christ. See OvercomingPornography.org

item.title: Meet Troy
item.description: Troy faces the reality of his addiction to pornography. Through honesty, repentance, and the healing power of the Atonement of Jesus Christ, he finds peace. See OvercomingPornography.org

item.title: Stay within the Lines
item.description: Just as athletes must stay within lines to compete in sports, those who are called to labor in the Lords work must stay within the lines of worthiness.

item.title: To Look Upon
item.description: (2 Samuel 11) Elder Dallin H. Oaks relates the story of King David to illustrate the dangers of pornography. See OvercomingPornography.org

item.title: Shun Immorality
item.description: (Genesis 39:1-20) President Hinckley encourages church members to avoid the immorality we have in the world today.

item.title: Watch Your Step
item.description: See how a moment’s decision can have far-reaching consequences—for good or bad.

item.title: Twelve Steps to Recovery
item.description: Coordinators and participants in the LDS 12-step addiction recovery program share their stories and their testimonies of the program. See OvercomingPornography.org

item.title: Better Things
item.description: Young men from the Deer Creek Ward share their testimonies about the perils of addiction. See OvercomingPornography.org

item.title: Living with Purpose and Real Intent
item.description: The gospel teaches us who we are and helps us maintain focus on our eternal purpose. Living with real intent ensures we reach the full measure of our creation.

item.title: The Hope of Gods Light
item.description: Many of us have wondered if God knows us or if He even exists. Todd was someone who wasn’t surprised when he didn’t get an immediate answer to a prayer. But could God be giving us small but obvious answers? And how patient do we need to be?

item.title: Wrong Roads
item.description: When making decisions, God expects us to pray, trust, and be believing and then not give up, panic, or jump ship when something doesnt seem to be going right.

item.title: Sermon on the Mount: The Lords Prayer
item.description: Jesus teaches his disciples the correct manner of prayer and offers the Lords prayer.

item.title: Jesus Warns Peter and Offers the Intercessory Prayer
item.description: Jesus admonishes Peter to remain faithful and strengthen his brethren. Peter professes his devotion to Jesus. Jesus foretells Peters denial and then gives the Intercessory Prayer.

item.title: Heavenly Father Knows Me
item.description: After a trial of her faith, a young woman receives a witness that Heavenly Father truly does answer prayers.

item.title: President Monson talks about Prayer
item.description: In the Sunday morning session of the October 2011 general conference, President Monson speaks about the necessity of prayer.

item.title: The Privilege of Prayer
item.description: Prayer is one of the most precious gifts of God to man.

item.title: Prayer—Sue
item.description: Sue knows that when she prays, there is really someone there who hears her.

item.title: Prayer—Terrence
item.description: Terrence discusses how he knows in his heart that God exists.

item.title: Prayer—Yvonne
item.description: Yvonne explains that we need to pray to God every day if we want to receive answers from Him.

item.title: Prayer and Conversion—Jennifer
item.description: Jennifer explains the importance of prayer in conversion.

item.title: Prayer—Jean
item.description: Jean shares how his membership in the church helped remind him that he could talk with his Heavenly Father through prayer.

item.title: Highlight: The Priesthood Man—Henry B. Eyring
item.description: Henry B. Eyring teaches men how they can follow—and be—examples of selfless priesthood service.

item.title: Pride and the Priesthood
item.description: Pride is a switch that turns off priesthood power. Humility is a switch that turns it on.

item.title: Pride Is Enmity
item.description: (3 Nephi 6:10–18) President Gordon B. Hinckley reads a message by President Ezra Taft Benson about the danger of pride.

item.title: The Pride Cycle
item.description: An illustration of the great pride of the people of Zarahemla about twenty years before the birth of the Savior. The prophet Nephi foretells the murder of the chief judge as a testimony of the peoples wickedness.

item.title: Pride Simulation Center
item.description: (Jacob 2) A father takes his family to a futuristic center to learn about pride. Through a simulated experience, two young people discover aspects of pride in their own lives. Segment 1, Pride Simulation Center.

item.title: Pride
item.description: (2 Kings 5:1-19) Elder Ballard tells the story of Naaman and relates it to pride.

item.title: Our Hands, His Hands; Our Hearts, His Heart
item.description: A very independent girl with cerebral palsy learns to humble herself and ask for help.

item.title: Spiritual Crocodiles
item.description: In his April 1976 general conference addresss, President Boyd K. Packer compared well-camouflaged crocodiles who prey on unwary victims to Satan, who preys on unwary youth by camouflaging the deadly nature of sin.

item.title: Steve’s Simulation
item.description: (Jacob 2) A father takes his family to a futuristic center to learn about pride. Through a simulated experience, two young people discover aspects of pride in their own lives. Segment 2, Steve’s Simulation.

item.title: Conclusion
item.description: (Jacob 2) A father takes his family to a futuristic center to learn about pride. Through a simulated experience, two young people discover aspects of pride in their own lives. Segment 3, Conclusion.

item.title: The Other Prodigal Son
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland shares the story of the older brother of the prodigal son and reminds us that no one of us is less treasured or cherished of God than another. He loves each of us—insecurities, anxieties, self-image, and all.

item.title: Abide with Me
item.description: How can you find true peace and comfort when change and confusion in the world becomes overwhelming? You can find solace by turning to God in prayer. Learn how the words from the hymn Abide with Me can strengthen you during times of despair.

item.title: Bullying - Stop It
item.description: Dieter F. Uchtdorf counsels us that when it comes to hating, gossiping, ignoring, ridiculing, holding grudges, or wanting to cause harm—stop it!

item.title: Christ and the Rich Young Ruler
item.description: Jesus Christ, the Son of God, teaches a rich man how to gain eternal life.

item.title: The Will of God
item.description: God uses love-inspired correction to guide us to a future we do not or cannot now envision but which He knows is the better way for us.

item.title: The Prodigal Son
item.description: Jesus tells the parable of the prodigal son.

item.title: A Mighty Change of Heart
item.description: (Alma 5:12–14) Elder Russell M. Nelson talks about “a mighty change” of heart.

item.title: If They Harden Not Their Hearts
item.description: This video depicts how pride led to the apostasy of Lyman Johnson and Thomas B. Marsh (DC 112:1-16).

item.title: Hypocrisy
item.description: (Matthew 23:2-28) Elder M. Eldon Tanner teaches of two kinds of hypocrisy.

item.title: Beware of Pride
item.description: President Ezra Taft Benson delivers a message titled Beware of Pride

item.title: The Weightier Matters of the Law: Judgment, Mercy, and Faith
item.description: We are to focus on the inward things of the heart, which we know and value intuitively but often neglect for that which is trivial, superficial, or prideful.

item.title: How the Church is Organized
item.description: A brief explanation of the organizational structure of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

item.title: Peter and John Heal a Man Crippled Since Birth
item.description: With authority from Jesus Christ, Peter and John heal a man crippled since birth.

item.title: Priesthood and Priesthood Keys - We Are Brothers
item.description: A quorum comes to understand what it means to hold priesthood keys as they reach out to fellow quorum members.

item.title: Jesus Raises the Daughter of Jairus
item.description: Jesus demonstrates His divine power by raising a young girl from the dead.

item.title: Jesus Calls Twelve Apostles to Preach and Bless Others
item.description: Jesus instructs and empowers His original Twelve Apostles.

item.title: Jesus Turns Water into Wine
item.description: Jesus performs a miraculous act of service in one of the first recorded events of His ministry.

item.title: Jesus Heals a Possessed Man
item.description: Jesus demonstrates His divine power by healing a possessed man.

item.title: Willing and Worthy to Serve
item.description: Miracles are everywhere to be found when the priesthood is understood, its power is honored and used properly, and faith is exerted.

item.title: The Powers of Heaven
item.description: Priesthood holders young and old need both authority and power—the necessary permission and the spiritual capacity to represent God in the work of salvation.

item.title: Priesthood Authority and Power
item.description: Statement by Elder David A. Bednar in the priesthood session on March 31, 2012.

item.title: The Last Supper
item.description: Meeting in an upper room with His disciples, Jesus washes their feet, institutes the sacrament, and commands them to love one another.

item.title: Priesthood Duty
item.description: A recent convert to the Church fulfills his priesthood duty by inviting all around him to come unto Christ.

item.title: Quorum Brotherhood
item.description: A quorum rallies around a young man who attended scouting activities for years. With their help, he comes to a knowledge of the truthfulness of the restored gospel, and is ordained to the Aaronic priesthood.

item.title: Aaronic Priesthood Shining Forth
item.description: Young men from around the world testify of the blessings of priesthood service and being faithful in fulfilling their Duty to God.

item.title: Preparation in the Priesthood: “I Need Your Help”
item.description: Don’t worry about how inexperienced you are or think you are, but think about what, with the Lord’s help, you can become.

item.title: The Power of the Aaronic Priesthood
item.description: You and the Aaronic Priesthood office you hold are essential to Heavenly Father’s work with His children and the preparation of this earth for the Second Coming.

item.title: Sanctify Yourselves
item.description: When a little league football player is struck by lightning, his 18-year-old assistant coach must be prepared to use his newly conferred Melchizedek Priesthood authority to call upon the healing powers of heaven.

item.title: Elder Perry on Priesthood Part 4
item.description: Elder Perry continues his series on the Priesthood, Restoration of Authority.

item.title: Priesthood Power
item.description: May we be worthy recipients of the divine power of the priesthood we bear. May it bless our lives and may we use it to bless the lives of others.

item.title: Learning in the Priesthood
item.description: If you will be diligent and obedient in the priesthood, treasures of spiritual knowledge will be poured out upon you.

item.title: Sacred Keys of the Aaronic Priesthood
item.description: The Lord wants every Aaronic Priesthood holder to invite all to come unto Christ—beginning with his own family.

item.title: Priesthood Treasures
item.description: Quote given by President Henry B. Eyring in the priesthood session of general conference on April 2, 2011.

item.title: Learn Your Duty
item.description: Quote given by Brother Larry M. Gibson in the priesthood session of general conference on April 2, 2011.

item.title: My Duty to God
item.description: Out of love, a 13-year-old boy in Arizona pushed himself to the limit so that his friend, who has cerebral palsy, could participate with him in a triathlon.

item.title: Becoming a Priesthood Man: Priesthood Duty
item.description: Michael strives to be an example and strengthen those around him. What started as a pregame devotional for him and his only Latter-day Saint teammate quickly became a tradition for many people on the football team.

item.title: Something Different About Us: Example
item.description: Luis sets an example for his friend who is not a member of the Church. He said of fulfilling his duties of the Aaronic Priesthood, “I’m representing Jesus Christ, and that’s amazing.

item.title: Let Every Man Learn His Duty: Aaronic Priesthood
item.description: Young men share their feelings about what it means to be a worthy holder of the priesthood. As one young man said, “Having the priesthood changes every decision I make.

item.title: Restoration of the Priesthood
item.description: Church members share how they personally have been blessed because Gods priesthood authority has been restored to the earth.

item.title: The Priesthood of Aaron
item.description: The priesthood you bear is a special gift, for the giver is the Lord Himself. Use it, magnify it, and live worthy of it.

item.title: Pride and the Priesthood
item.description: Pride is a switch that turns off priesthood power. Humility is a switch that turns it on.

item.title: The Magnificent Priesthood
item.description: Brother David L. Beck highlights the blessings that come when each young man learns and does his duty.

item.title: Highlight: The Keys and Authority of the Priesthood—Dallin H. Oaks
item.description: Dallin H. Oaks teaches how men and women, though they have different roles, serve and are blessed on the same terms through the priesthood.

item.title: The Preparatory Priesthood
item.description: Highlight of President Henry B. Eyrings address at the October 2014 General Conference.

item.title: Roll Up Our Sleeves
item.description: Individual Latter-day Saints share their thoughts and experiences as members in the Church.

item.title: The Welcome Table
item.description: Individual Latter-day Saints share their thoughts and experiences as members in the Church.

item.title: A New Day
item.description: Latter-day Saints share their reactions to the 1978 reversal of the priesthood restriction on members of black African descent.

item.title: Gods Children in Every Aspect
item.description: The face of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints reflects every race and culture and has more color, more diversity, than ever before. The gospel of Jesus Christ embraces all people.

item.title: A Person and A Sister
item.description: Individual Latter-day Saints share their thoughts and experiences as members in the Church

item.title: We Come Together Unite As One
item.description: As much as our differences enrich our collective experience, the Gospel of Jesus Christ transcends them all.

item.title: Diversity Is Good
item.description: Individual Latter-day Saints share their thoughts and experiences as members in the Church

item.title: Revelation on Priesthood Accepted, Church Officers Sustained
item.description: Revelation on Priesthood Accepted, Church Officers Sustained

item.title: The Gospel— A Global Faith
item.description: President Howard W. Hunter delivers a message titled The Gospel— A Global Faith.

item.title: The Need for Greater Kindness
item.description: Why do any of us have to be so mean and unkind to others? Why can’t all of us reach out in friendship to everyone about us?

item.title: Doctrine of Inclusion
item.description: If we are truly disciples of the Lord Jesus Christ, we will reach out with love and understanding to all of our neighbors at all times.

item.title: Mormon Apostle Promotes Religious Freedom
item.description: Elder L. Tom Perry Promotes Religious Freedom.

item.description: Cartoon drawing about religious freedom.

item.title: Preserving Religious Freedom
item.description: Preserving Religious Freedom video.

item.title: Repentance—Doug
item.description: Doug discovers there is more to life and talks about repentance.

item.title: You Can Meet Gods Expectations
item.description: Quote given by Elder D. Todd Christofferson in the Sunday afternoon session of general conference on April 3, 2011.

item.description: A young boy’s encounter with a scorpion in the Arabian desert can teach us a lot about what we must do to avoid and overcome the venomous sting of sin.

item.title: Redemption
item.description: Through Christ, people can and do change their lives and obtain redemption.

item.title: The Divine Gift of Repentance
item.description: Only through repentance do we gain access to the atoning grace of Jesus Christ.

item.description: Jesus shows that He has power to both forgive sins and heal physical infirmities.

item.title: Prodigal Son
item.description: (Luke 15:11-32) Elder Robert D. Hales talks about the Prodigal Son.

item.title: Forgive 70 Times 7
item.description: Jesus explains how we are to treat our offending brethren.

item.title: The Shiny Bicycle
item.description: Everybody sins and makes mistakes, and even though its not easy, with Heavenly Fathers and Jesus Christs help we can find a way to fix them and receive forgiveness.

item.title: Daily Bread: Change
item.description: Jesus Christ is the bread of eternal life. By following Him, remembering Him, and having faith in Him we can change and become what we aspire to become.

item.title: Jesus Declares the Parable of the Lost Sheep
item.description: Jesus teaches there shall be joy in heaven over one repentant sinner.

item.title: Abide with Me
item.description: How can you find true peace and comfort when change and confusion in the world becomes overwhelming? You can find solace by turning to God in prayer. Learn how the words from the hymn Abide with Me can strengthen you during times of despair.

item.title: The Other Prodigal Son
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland shares the story of the older brother of the prodigal son and reminds us that no one of us is less treasured or cherished of God than another. He loves each of us—insecurities, anxieties, self-image, and all.

item.description: Dieter F. Uchtdorf counsels us that when it comes to hating, gossiping, ignoring, ridiculing, holding grudges, or wanting to cause harm—stop it!

item.title: Highlight: Love—the Essence of the Gospel—Thomas S. Monson
item.description: Thomas S. Monson teaches how small acts of love, kindness, and forgiveness can make a big difference in others lives.

item.title: Highlight: Spiritual Whirlwinds—Neil L. Andersen
item.description: Neil L. Andersen encourages youth to trust in God during challenges and promises that they will receive the Lords protection and guidance.

item.title: See Others as They May Become
item.description: Quote given by President Thomas S. Monson in the Priesthood session on October 6, 2012.

item.title: “Yes, Lord, I Will Follow Thee”
item.description: Highlight of Elder Eduardo Gavarrets address at the October 2014 General Conference.

item.title: Prophets and Revelation - Hearing His Voice
item.description: A seminary class in Samoa learns that seeking revelation requires effort and action.

item.title: Reverence Invites Revelation
item.description: (Mark 11:15-18) President Boyd K. Packer teaches of the importance of reverence in receiving revelation.

item.description: John the Baptist is born. Zacharias prophesies of John’s mission to prepare the way for the Son of God.

item.description: Highlight of President Henry B. Eyrings address at the October 2014 General Conference.

item.title: Sustaining the Prophets
item.description: Highlight of Elder Russell M. Nelsons address at the October 2014 General Conference.

item.title: Trifle Not with Sacred Things
item.description: Highlight of Elder Larry S. Kachers address at the October 2014 General Conference.

item.title: Seek, Receive, Act
item.description: General conference gives us the opportunity to seek, receive, and act on personal revelation. We can receive inspired guidance to help us grow and become who Heavenly Father needs us to be.

item.title: Christine
item.description: Christine was struggling with one particular challenge, but when she heard President Uchtdorf speak at general conference, she made a commitment that would scare most of us.

item.title: Ryan
item.description: Ryan is a busy dad with active kids, who need his attention. Since general conference, hes changed his focus from screen time to family time. How have your priorities shifted in the past month?

item.title: Walter
item.description: Walter needed one message from #LDSconf and he received it. Now hes changing as a result.

item.title: Ruth
item.description: This mom wanted just one question answered when she watched general conference. Because of what she heard, her kids are now praying for peanut butter cookies and shes glad.

item.title: Living with Purpose and Real Intent
item.description: The gospel teaches us who we are and helps us maintain focus on our eternal purpose. Living with real intent ensures we reach the full measure of our creation.

item.title: Scriptures Legacy – Extended Broadcast Version
item.description: Ancient and modern prophets and disciples sacrificed much to preserve and provide the scriptures. These scriptures now help us measure correctness and truth, strengthen our faith, and light our path.

item.title: Scriptures Legacy
item.description: Ancient and modern prophets and disciples sacrificed much to preserve and provide the scriptures. These scriptures now help us measure correctness and truth, strengthen our faith, and light our path.

item.title: Reflecting Gods Love—What Scriptures Mean to Me
item.description: A seasoned leader discusses the role of the scriptures in his personal life and callings over the years as he strives to reflect the love God has for his children.

item.description: A sister discusses the role the scriptures play as she strives to be a better mother; teaching and raising each of her children as Christ would want her to teach them.

item.description: A young brother discusses the role of the scriptures in his and his mother’s conversion, in his own mission experience, and in his ongoing role as a young father and Church member.

item.description: A seminary class in Samoa learns that seeking revelation requires effort and action.

item.description: President Eyring speaks of the importance of studying the Book of Mormon daily.

item.title: The Book of Mormon—a Book from God

item.description: Belinda explains how the Book of Mormon confirms to her that Jesus is the Christ.

item.title: “Lord, Is It I?”
